member.name: T:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.CascadeSoftDelService`1
member.summary: This service handles multiple, cascade soft delete, i.e. it soft deletes an entity and its dependent relationships
member.typeparam: You provide the interface you applied to your entity classes to require a boolean flag

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.CascadeSoftDelService`1.#ctor(SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.CascadeSoftDeleteConfiguration{`0})
member.summary: This provides a equivalent to a SQL cascade delete, but using a soft delete approach.

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.CascadeSoftDelService`1.SetCascadeSoftDeleteViaKeys``1(System.Object[])
member.summary: This finds the entity using its primary key(s) and then cascade soft deletes the entity any dependent entities with the correct delete behaviour
member.param: primary key values
member.returns: Returns status. If not errors then Result has the number of entities that have been soft deleted. Zero if error of Not Found and notFoundAllowed is true

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.CascadeSoftDelService`1.ResetCascadeSoftDeleteViaKeys``1(System.Object[])
member.summary: This finds the entity using its primary key(s) and then resets the soft delete flag so it is now visible
member.param: primary key values
member.returns: Returns status. If not errors then Result has the number of entities that have been reset. Zero if error of Not Found and notFoundAllowed is true

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.CascadeSoftDelService`1.CheckCascadeSoftDeleteViaKeys``1(System.Object[])
member.summary: This finds the entity using its primary key(s) and counts this entity and any dependent entities that are already been cascade soft deleted and are valid to be hard deleted.
member.param: primary key values
member.returns: Returns status. If not errors then Message contains a message to warn what will be deleted if the HardDelete... method is called. Zero if error of Not Found and notFoundAllowed is true

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.CascadeSoftDelService`1.HardDeleteSoftDeletedEntriesViaKeys``1(System.Object[])
member.summary: This finds the entity using its primary key(s) and hard deletes this entity and any dependent entities that are already been cascade soft deleted.
member.param: primary key values
member.returns: Returns status. If not errors then Result has the number of entities that have been hard deleted. Zero if error of Not Found and notFoundAllowed is true

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.CascadeSoftDelService`1.SetCascadeSoftDelete``1(``0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This with cascade soft delete this entity and any dependent entities with the correct delete behaviour
member.param: entity class with cascade soft delete interface. Mustn't be null
Defaults to calling SaveChanges. If set to false, then you must call SaveChanges
member.returns: Returns a status. If no errors then Result contains the number of entities that had been cascaded deleted, plus summary string in Message part

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.CascadeSoftDelService`1.ResetCascadeSoftDelete``1(``0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This will result the cascade soft delete flag on this entity and any dependent entities with the correct delete behaviour and cascade level
member.param: entity class with cascade soft delete interface. Mustn't be null
Defaults to calling SaveChanges. If set to false, then you must call SaveChanges
member.returns: Returns a status. If no errors then Result contains the number of entities that had been reset, plus summary string in Message part

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.CascadeSoftDelService`1.CheckCascadeSoftDelete``1(``0)
member.summary: This looks for this entity and any dependent entities that are already been cascade soft deleted and are valid to be hard deleted.
member.param: entity class with cascade soft delete interface. Mustn't be null
member.returns: Returns a status. If no errors then Result contains the number of entities which are eligible for hard delete, plus summary string in Message part

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.CascadeSoftDelService`1.HardDeleteSoftDeletedEntries``1(``0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This hard deletes this entity and any dependent entities that are already been cascade soft deleted
member.param: entity class with cascade soft delete interface. Mustn't be null
Defaults to calling SaveChanges. If set to false, then you must call SaveChanges
member.returns: Returns a status. If no errors then Result contains the number of entities which were hard deleted, plus summary string in Message part

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.CascadeSoftDelService`1.GetSoftDeletedEntries``1
member.summary: This returns the cascade soft deleted entities of type TEntity that can be reset, i.e. SoftDeleteLevel == 1

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.Internal.CascadeWalker`1.ApplyChangeIfAppropriate(`0,System.Byte)
member.summary: This checks if something has to be done for this entity If it should not be changed it returns true, which says don't go any deeper from this entity If it should be changed then it does the change and returns false

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.Internal.ExpressionBuilder.FilterToGetValueSingleSoftDeletedEntities``2(SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.SingleSoftDeleteConfiguration{``1})
member.summary: This returns a where filter that returns all the valid entities that have been single soft deleted

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.Internal.ExpressionBuilder.FilterToGetValueCascadeSoftDeletedEntities``2(SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.CascadeSoftDeleteConfiguration{``1},System.Byte)
member.summary: This returns a where filter that returns all the valid entities that have been cascade soft deleted

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.Internal.ExpressionBuilder.FormOtherFiltersOnly``1(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Type,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{System.Object,System.Boolean}}})
member.summary: This returns all the entities of this type that are valid, e.g. not filtered out by other parts of the Query filters Relies on the user filling in the OtherFilters part of the config

member.name: T:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.SingleSoftDeleteService`1
member.summary: This service handles single soft delete, i.e. it only soft deletes a single entity by setting a boolean flag in that entity
member.typeparam: You provide the interface you applied to your entity classes to require a boolean flag

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.SingleSoftDeleteService`1.#ctor(SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.SingleSoftDeleteConfiguration{`0})
member.summary: Ctor for SoftDeleteService

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.SingleSoftDeleteService`1.SetSoftDeleteViaKeys``1(System.Object[])
member.summary: This finds the entity using its primary key(s) and then set the single soft delete flag so it is hidden
member.param: primary key values
member.returns: Returns status. If not errors then Result return 1 to say it worked. Zero if error of Not Found and notFoundAllowed is true

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.SingleSoftDeleteService`1.ResetSoftDeleteViaKeys``1(System.Object[])
member.summary: This finds the entity using its primary key(s) and then it resets the single soft delete flag so it is now visible
member.param: primary key values
member.returns: Returns status. If not errors then Result return 1 to say it worked. Zero if error of Not Found and notFoundAllowed is true

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.SingleSoftDeleteService`1.HardDeleteViaKeys``1(System.Object[])
member.summary: This finds the entity using its primary key(s) and then hard deletes it as long as the soft delete flag is set
member.param: primary key values
member.returns: Returns status. If not errors then Result return 1 to say it worked. Zero if error of Not Found and notFoundAllowed is true

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.SingleSoftDeleteService`1.SetSoftDelete(`0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This will single soft delete the entity
member.param: Mustn't be null
Defaults to calling SaveChanges. If set to false, then you must call SaveChanges
member.returns: Returns status. If not errors then Result return 1 to say it worked. Zero if error

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.SingleSoftDeleteService`1.ResetSoftDelete(`0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This resets the single soft delete flag so that entity is now visible
member.param: Mustn't be null
Defaults to calling SaveChanges. If set to false, then you must call SaveChanges
member.returns: Returns status. If not errors then Result return 1 to say it worked. Zero if errors

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.SingleSoftDeleteService`1.HardDeleteSoftDeletedEntry``1(``0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This hard deletes (i.e. calls EF Core's Remove method) for this entity ONLY if it first been soft deleted. This will delete the entity and possibly delete other dependent entities.
member.param: The entity to delete
Defaults to calling SaveChanges. If set to false, then you must call SaveChanges yourself
member.returns: The number of entities that were deleted. This will include any dependent entities that that had a cascade delete behaviour

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.SingleSoftDeleteService`1.GetSoftDeletedEntries``1
member.summary: This returns the soft deleted entities of type TEntity If you set up the OtherFilters property in the config then it will apply all the appropriate query filter so you only see the ones you should

member.summary: This service handles single soft delete, i.e. it only soft deletes a single entity by setting a boolean flag in that entity
member.typeparam: You provide the interface you applied to your entity classes to require a boolean flag

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.SingleSoftDeleteServiceAsync`1.SetSoftDeleteAsync(`0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This will soft delete the single entity. This may delete other dependent
member.param: Mustn't be null
Defaults to calling SaveChanges. If set to false, then you must call SaveChanges
member.returns: Returns status. If not errors then Result return 1 to say it worked. Zero if error

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.SingleSoftDeleteServiceAsync`1.ResetSoftDeleteAsync(`0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This resets the single soft delete flag so that entity is now visible
member.param: Mustn't be null
Defaults to calling SaveChanges. If set to false, then you must call SaveChanges yourself

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.SingleSoftDeleteServiceAsync`1.HardDeleteSoftDeletedEntryAsync``1(``0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This hard deletes (i.e. calls EF Core's Remove method) for this entity ONLY if it first been soft deleted. This will delete the entity and possibly delete other dependent entities.
member.param: The entity to delete
Defaults to calling SaveChanges. If set to false, then you must call SaveChanges yourself
member.returns: The number of entities that were deleted. This will include any dependent entities that that had a cascade delete behaviour

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Concrete.SingleSoftDeleteServiceAsync`1.GetSoftDeletedEntries``1
member.summary: This returns the soft deleted entities of type TEntity If you set up the OtherFilters property in the config then it will apply all the appropriate query filter so you only see the ones you should

member.name: P:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.BaseSoftDeleteConfiguration.Context
member.summary: This is used by the soft delete services to gain access to the specific DbContext used

member.name: P:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.BaseSoftDeleteConfiguration.OtherFilters
member.summary: If you have other query filters, such as a multi-tenant system with a UserId or DataKey, then you MUST add the same query(s) to this dictionary. This will apply these filters to all the soft delete commands to make sure you aren't seeing/altering an entry you shouldn't be able to access See this example https://github.com/JonPSmith/EfCore.SoftDeleteServices/blob/master/Test/ExampleConfigs/ConfigSoftDeleteWithUserId.cs

member.name: P:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.BaseSoftDeleteConfiguration.NotFoundIsNotAnError
member.summary: If this property is set to true, then it won't produce an error This is useful for Web APIs where not finding something require a different return

member.name: P:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.BaseSoftDeleteConfiguration.TextSoftDeletedPastTense
member.summary: This text is used in various errors and success messages when talking about soft deleting for instance "This entry is already soft deleted"

member.name: T:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.CascadeSoftDeleteConfiguration`1
member.summary: Inherit this class to configure a cascade soft delete service

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.CascadeSoftDeleteConfiguration`1.#ctor(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContext)
member.summary: This must be called by your configuration constructor to provide the DbContext to be used

member.name: P:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.CascadeSoftDeleteConfiguration`1.GetSoftDeleteValue
member.summary: This should contain an expression that returns the soft delete value. e.g. entity => entity.SoftDeletedLevel Ideally the expression should work in a EF Core query, but if it can't then please provide a expression for the that does work in a query

member.name: P:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.CascadeSoftDeleteConfiguration`1.QuerySoftDeleteValue
P:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.CascadeSoftDeleteConfiguration`1.SetSoftDeleteValue
member.summary: This should contain an action to set the soft delete value e.g. (entity, value) => { entity.SoftDeletedLevel = value; };

member.name: P:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.CascadeSoftDeleteConfiguration`1.ReadEveryTime
member.summary: If you are using my approach to collections, where a collection is null if it isn't loaded, then you can improve the performance of Cascade soft delete by loading the entity with Includes to load the collections and setting this property to false NOTE: It only works on SetCascadeSoftDelete as on the reset you can't include soft deleted entities

member.name: T:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.DiRegisterHelpers
member.summary: Holds extension method for finding and registering your Soft Delete configurations and services

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.DiRegisterHelpers.RegisterSoftDelServicesAndYourConfigurations(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Reflection.Assembly[])
member.summary: This will scan the assemblies that you provide (or the calling assembly) for your Soft Delete configurations who base class is SingleSoftDeleteConfiguration or CascadeSoftDeleteConfiguration. From your configurations it will register the correct types of the services you need to call.
member.param: If not provided it will scan just the assembly that called this method
member.returns: Logs about what was registered. Useful if the registering doesn't do what you want

member.name: T:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.SingleSoftDeleteConfiguration`1
member.summary: Inherit this class to configure a single soft delete service

member.name: M:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.SingleSoftDeleteConfiguration`1.#ctor(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContext)
member.summary: This must be called by your configuration constructor to provide the DbContext to be used

member.name: P:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.SingleSoftDeleteConfiguration`1.GetSoftDeleteValue
member.summary: This should contain an expression that returns the soft delete value. e.g. entity => entity.SoftDeleted Ideally the expression should work in a EF Core query, but if it can't then please provide a expression for the that does work in a query

member.name: P:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.SingleSoftDeleteConfiguration`1.QuerySoftDeleteValue
P:SoftDeleteServices.Configuration.SingleSoftDeleteConfiguration`1.SetSoftDeleteValue
member.summary: This should contain an action to set the soft delete value e.g. (entity, value) => { entity.SoftDeleted = value; };
